Posts.Content: Benotto wrote: I had experienced bloody discharge from my left nipple and had an ultrasound guided biopsy on 3/1.  The biopsy didn't show anything cancerous (dense fibrous breast tissue), but it also didn't show a papilloma or other reason for the bleeding.  The surgeon I met with last week is assuming the biopsy missed the mass; I am scheduled for a lumpectomy next Wednesday 3/21. Unfortunately, I couldn't leave well enough alone and checked myself in the shower this morning.  I noticed bleeding from a second duct.  Oops!  I phoned the surgeon and she has scheduled a follow-up ultrasound/mammogram the day after tomorrow.  She says she intends to remove the second duct regardless, but wants to see what's changed in the past 2-3 weeks.  (Radiology report from three weeks ago:  Hypoechoic area of duct ectasia containing probable debris)  I, of course, am in a panic.  Whatever I've found about bloody discharge has said it's 'probably nothing' if it is just the one duct, so what does it mean if there is suddenly a second?  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Second duct with bloody discharge? Benotto awb

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2012 09:53PM Benotto wrote: Thanks, Debbie, for getting back to me.  I was disappointed in myself that I didn't insist on more of an explanation at the time and your answer was very reassuring.  The doctor called with the biopsy report this morning, by the way,  It was, thankfully, just a benign papilloma, so no further treatment is necessary.  I did, however, have a bit of a set back in that I ended up back in surgery yesterday for a hematoma.  The lumpectomy was Wednesday morning, I was fine Thursday morning, but started going downhill Thursday afternoon.  I was exhausted and there was a lot of swelling, but it wasn't red and there was no fever, so I figured I'd just call the next morning.  Unfortunately, I woke up at midnight soaked in blood and extremely lightheaded, so off to the ER we went.  I was thankful for all the obsessive research I'd done on BCO, because I went in knowing what a hematoma was and that it was easily fixable.  I can't imagine how panicked I'd have been otherwise. I'm very grateful for the information and support on sites like this!
Posts.Title: Second duct with bloody discharge? Benotto awb

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2012 10:30AM Benotto wrote: Thanks for getting back to me so quickly, and thanks for the reminder that no news it good news!  I am beginning to agree with what I've read a couple of times on this forum, that the waiting and not knowing is the hardest part.  I don't know what I'm so worked up about, I mean, I'm having surgery regardless, but the guessing game of trying to read between the lines of reports and figuring out the hidden meaning behind every interaction drives one bonkers!  To answer your question, no I am not currently breastfeeding - my kids are 10 and 14, so I am more than happy for the doctor to remove as many ducts as she needs!  And, for what it is worth, it is a second duct on the same breast (2:30,11:30).  I was relieved after the biopsy, at least until the surgeon pointed out that it also didn't show a papilloma.  While everyone else has been "it's probably nothing", she was a little more "radiation really isn't that big a deal."
Posts.Title: Second duct with bloody discharge? Benotto awb

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2012 09:56AM Benotto wrote: I had a wire localization and lumpectomy yesterday morning.  Other than realizing too late that Vicodin keeps me up (did I even sleep last night?!?), everything went smoothly. I do have a question concerning my ultrasound, though.  I had an ultrasound last week showing the second bloody duct, but yesterday they determined it was a second branch of the same duct.  I totally get that, if it has branched into a 'Y', squeezing on opposite sides of the breast would cause bleeding from the one duct.  What I don't understand, and am kicking myself for not pushing for more of an explanation yesterday, is that the discharge was coming out of two entirely separate places on the surface:  When I pressed on the right side, discharge from the right side of the nipple.  When I gave the left a squeeze, blood came from the other corner.  Even if I were brave enough to rough myself up, at this point everything is under dressings for another 48 hours. Can one duct lead to two separate openings on the surface?  Maybe I'm just missing a step in the anatomy here.
Posts.Title: Second duct with bloody discharge? Benotto awb
